DataElement.longName: First Degree Relative Cancer Diagnosis Indicator
DataElement.definition: A response to indicate if any relative has a medical history that includes cancer.
DataElement.administrativeNotes: 11/11/23 Released per PCDC-U of Chicago/Mei Li. BF;4/4/23 Created for the PCDC-C3DC Aggregated Dictionary data elements. jk

DataElementConcept.definition: Report or record of a cancer diagnosis in any relative with whom one half of an individual's genes is shared (i.e., parent, sibling, offspring).

ObjectClass.definition: Any relative who is one meiosis away from a particular individual in a family; a relative with whom one half of an individual's genes is shared (i.e., parent, sibling, offspring) (from Genetics Home Reference glossary)

Concepts.definition: Any relative who is one meiosis away from a particular individual in a family; a relative with whom one half of an individual's genes is shared (i.e., parent, sibling, offspring) (from Genetics Home Reference glossary)

Property.definition: A tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues.  Malignant neoplasms usually metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision.  The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas (adenocarcinomas or squamous cell carcinomas), Hodgkin's and non-Hodgkin's lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas. -- 2004:The process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms.

Concepts.definition: The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.

A neoplasm composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas, Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas.

ConceptualDomain.definition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

ValueDomain.longName: Yes No Unknown Not Reported Indicator
ValueDomain.definition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.
ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created for Q12018 dictionary update request 1/30/18 mc

ValueMeaning.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.definition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.
ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 3/4/25 Added alt VM names per RFC 26 CR 1. sl

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ConceptualDomain.definition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.definition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation. Indicators determine or aid in determining whether or not certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied. (On-line Medical Dictionary)

Concepts.definition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ClassificationSchemes.longName: PCDC (Pediatric Cancer Data Commons Aggregated Dictionary)
